% THIS FILE IS AUTO-GENERATED FROM THE FILE options.
% DO NOT MODIFY
\documentclass{article}
\title{Shimple Options}
\author{Navindra Umanee}
\begin{document}
\maketitle
This document describes the command-line options to Shimple.
Values for options are specified on the Soot command-line, following
the switch \texttt{-p simple}. For example:

\noindent \texttt{java soot.Main -p shimple scalars-only --shimple hello}

Shimple is still under active development, so these options are subject
to change. For the most current, automatically generated version of
this document, please see the file
\texttt{src/soot/shimple/doc/opts.ps}
in your Soot directory.
\tableofcontents
\section{General Options}
\subsection{Option \tt optimize}
\begin{itemize}
\item Allowed values: {\tt  true false}
\item Default value: {\tt false}
\end{itemize}
When this option is set to true, Shimple-based optimizations are applied.
\section{Options for Leaving Shimple}
\subsection{Option \tt naive-phi-elimination}
\begin{itemize}
\item Allowed values: {\tt  true false}
\item Default value: {\tt false}
\end{itemize}
If set to true, neither pre-optimization nor post-optimization will be applied
to the Phi elimination process.  Note that setting this option to true takes
precedence over other Phi elimination options.
\subsection{Option \tt pre-optimize-phi-elimination}
\begin{itemize}
\item Allowed values: {\tt  true false}
\item Default value: {\tt false}
\end{itemize}
If set to true, some optimizations are applied before Phi nodes are eliminated.
\subsection{Option \tt post-optimize-phi-elimination}
\begin{itemize}
\item Allowed values: {\tt  true false}
\item Default value: {\tt true}
\end{itemize}
If set to false, optimizations are not applied after eliminating Phi nodes.
\end{document}
